name: "The Flash" 3.14 "Attack on Central City" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who opened the breach to let Grodd get to Earth-1?
questions.explanation:
Gypsy.

	Gypsy was the interdimensional cop that had come to track down Harrison Wells a few episodes earlier. Somehow she ended up in Grodd's universe under his control. He forced her to open the breach for him and his fellow gorillas.

questions.text: What holiday was the Speed Lab decorated for early in the episode?
questions.explanation:
Friend's Day.

	HR, which was one of the two versions of Harrison Wells featured in the episode, decorated the lab for Friend's Day. None of the rest of the team knew that that was. He explained that it was his Earth's version of Valentine's Day.

questions.text: The two versions of Harrison Wells became good friends.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Harrison Wells, the genius from season two, very much disliked HR, the less intelligent version from season three. The two were complete opposites of each other. Both were played by Tom Cavanagh. A different version of the character was in the show's first season.

questions.text: What type of animal is Grodd?
questions.explanation:
Gorilla.

	His name in the comic books is the one the nose Gorilla Grodd, when he debuted on the TV show he was simply named Grodd. Grodd, voiced by David Sobolov, appeared in each of the first three seasons of the show.

questions.text: Who was the third speedster to appear in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Jesse Quick.

	Jesse Quick, played by Violett Beane, is Kid Flash's girlfriend. She appeared in a few season 2 episodes and made her season three debut in the first part of this 2-part episode. She is a genius, and the daughter of Earth-2's Harrison Wells.

questions.text: Who was the first human Grodd attempted to kill in the episode?
questions.explanation:
Joe West.

	Grodd took control of Joe in order to talk to Barry. During the conversation he told Barry that he knew Joe was important to him and, using his mind control, made Joe shoot himself. Flash, who was standing just a few feet away, managed to move Joe out of the way in the split second before the bullet hit him in the head.

questions.text: Who wanted to kill Grodd in order to stop his attack on Central City?
questions.explanation:
Barry.

	Barry, while talking to Iris, said he thought it was best to just kill Grodd. He told her that he's shown too much mercy in the past. She told him that showing mercy is what made him a hero.

questions.text: What military base did Grodd sneak onto by using mind control on a general?
questions.explanation:
Fort Reynolds.

	The base is home to a nuclear weapons testing facility. When Grodd is controlling a person they have a version of his voice, the general covered for that saying he was sick. His fingerprint and retinal scan remained unchanged and he was granted access to the base. It was an Air Force base.

questions.text: Who beat Grodd, ending the attack?
questions.explanation:
Solovar.

	Solovar was the former leader of the gorillas from Gorilla City on Earth-2. He was beaten in the previous episode by Barry Allen/The Flash. Because of Barry's choice not to kill Solovar, he was still alive to challenge Grodd for leadership again. Gypsy brought him to Earth-1, where he defeated Grodd and Barry then convinced Solovar to spare Grodd's life.

questions.text: Who kissed Cisko near the end of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Gypsy.

	Cisco had a crush on her since her first appearance. Earlier in the episode he kept joking that she wanted to spend more time with him, but she convinced him to let her go back to her real job on another Earth. She returned to help with the fight against the Gorillas. Before leaving again, she told Cisco that he couldn't handle her and then kissed him.
